chunks.original_text: 仙真圣二十七品者，按《宋文明通门下》云：上品曰圣，中品曰真，下品曰仙也。 圣品以复有三也，真品复有三也，仙品复有三也，合为九品也。 九品又各有三，合为二十七品也。 《宋文明道德义渊下》又引《八素经》云：上真给仙童玉女二千人，中真给玉童玉女千人，下真给玉童玉女五百人。 《回元九道素经》亦有差品。 《大洞经》云：从生得道，从道得仙，从仙得真，从真得为上清。 黄老君则上仙，但备上仙之道，未及上真也。 佛四果之人，已称贤圣，成佛得道，而号大仙，道圆自始飞天而升太极，及成无上方、号高仙。 邪法身云：转神入妙形，魂为一身神，并一则为真身而成道也。 《玄门论第十三》位业品云：界外三九二十七品，贤圣之名者。 《太真科》云：小乘仙有九品：一者上仙，二者高仙，三者大仙，四者神仙，五者玄仙，六者真仙，七者天仙，八者灵仙，九者至仙也。 中乘真有九品：一者上真，二者高真，三者大真，四者神真，五者玄真，六者仙真，七者天真，八者灵真，九者至真也。 大乘圣有九品：一者上圣，二者高圣，三者大 圣，四者神圣，五者玄圣，六者真圣，七者仙圣，八者灵圣，九者至圣也。 虽有三九不同，而俱无欲并观。 观体不复无优劣，故有仙圣之殊。 但上圣、高圣、大圣、是圣之上品。 神圣、玄圣、真圣、是圣之次品。 仙圣、灵圣、至圣，是圣之下品。 圣品既尔，仙真可知。 此三九人，若望界内通，是大乘也。 二十七大夫者 按《太真科》云：二十七大夫者，圣真仙阶各有九品，三九二十七。 应宿也，宿二十八日月桓舍其一，一为隐故 二十七天者 已具录在三名数、三气、三天部中讫。 人身中二十七生气君者 按《老子枕中开闱经》云：人身中自有二十七生气君者，发为青城君，头为三台君，两眉为八极君，左目为瞻明君，右目为玄明君，左耳 为听明君，右耳 为决明君，鼻为周天妙户君，口为牙门君，唇为玉户．君，齿为二十八元士君，舌为无极君，咽为校尉君，喉为九卿君，肝为绛宫君，肺为华盖君，胆为长命君，心为丹田君，脐为紫白君，胃为太仓君，脾为黄庭君，左肾为玄妙君，右肾为元正君，大肠为食母君，小肠为道引君，肠为卫道君，三焦为玄先君，左股为小车君，右股为徘徊君，左足为雷电君，右足为云气君，二十七生气常当世隐甲，身君勿得妄出也 。 今若细数，乃有三十一君，不详之。
chunks.translated_text:
**The Twenty-Seven Ranks of Immortals, Perfected, and Sages**

As recorded in *The Comprehensive Gate of Song Wenming*: the highest rank is called *sage*, the middle rank *perfected*, and the lowest rank *immortal*. The *sage* rank further divides into three, the *perfected* rank into three, and the *immortal* rank into three, totaling nine ranks. Each of these nine ranks again divides into three, making twenty-seven ranks in all.

*The Profound Meaning of Dao and Virtue by Song Wenming* further cites *The Eight Simplicities Scripture*: the highest *perfected* are attended by two thousand jade boys and jade maidens, the middle *perfected* by one thousand, and the lowest *perfected* by five hundred. *The Ninefold Return to the Primal Simplicities Scripture* likewise distinguishes ranks.

*The Great Cavern Scripture* states: from life one attains the Dao, from the Dao one attains immortality, from immortality one attains *perfected* status, and from *perfected* status one attains *Upper Clarity*. The Yellow and Lao Lords are *upper immortals*, having mastered the Dao of the *upper immortals* but not yet attained the *upper perfected*.

In Buddhism, those who achieve the four fruits are called *worthy sages*; upon attaining Buddhahood and the Dao, they are styled *great immortals*. When the Dao is complete, they ascend from the beginning of flight to the *Great Ultimate*, and upon achieving the *Supreme Realm*, they are called *lofty immortals*.

The heterodox teachings speak of transforming the spirit into a wondrous form, where the hun-soul becomes the spirit of the body, and when unified, it becomes the *true body* and attains the Dao.

*The Thirteenth Chapter of Discourses on the Mysterious Gate*, in its section on *Positions and Karma*, states: beyond the realms, there are three nines—twenty-seven ranks—known as the names of *worthy sages*.

*The Regulations of the Supreme Perfected* states: the *Lesser Vehicle* of immortals has nine ranks: (1) *upper immortal*, (2) *lofty immortal*, (3) *great immortal*, (4) *spirit immortal*, (5) *mysterious immortal*, (6) *true immortal*, (7) *heavenly immortal*, (8) *numinous immortal*, and (9) *ultimate immortal*. The *Middle Vehicle* of the *perfected* has nine ranks: (1) *upper perfected*, (2) *lofty perfected*, (3) *great perfected*, (4) *spirit perfected*, (5) *mysterious perfected*, (6) *immortal perfected*, (7) *heavenly perfected*, (8) *numinous perfected*, and (9) *ultimate perfected*. The *Great Vehicle* of *sages* has nine ranks: (1) *upper sage*, (2) *lofty sage*, (3) *great sage*, (4) *spirit sage*, (5) *mysterious sage*, (6) *true sage*, (7) *immortal sage*, (8) *numinous sage*, and (9) *ultimate sage*.

Though the three nines differ, all are free from desire and engage in contemplation. The object of contemplation is not without distinction, hence the differences among *immortals*, *perfected*, and *sages*. The *upper sage*, *lofty sage*, and *great sage* are the highest ranks of *sages*; the *spirit sage*, *mysterious sage*, and *true sage* are the middle ranks; and the *immortal sage*, *numinous sage*, and *ultimate sage* are the lowest ranks. The ranks of *sages* being thus, those of *immortals* and *perfected* may be inferred. These three nines of people, when viewed in relation to the realms within, constitute the *Great Vehicle*.

**The Twenty-Seven Great Men**

As recorded in *The Regulations of the Supreme Perfected*: the twenty-seven great men correspond to the nine ranks each of *sages*, *perfected*, and *immortals*, totaling three nines—twenty-seven. They align with the celestial lodges, where the twenty-eight lunar mansions omit one, as one is hidden.

**The Twenty-Seven Heavens**

These have already been recorded in the sections on the *Three Names and Numbers*, *Three Qi*, and *Three Heavens*.

**The Twenty-Seven Lords of Life-*Qi* Within the Human Body**

As recorded in *The Scripture of Laozi’s Pillow for Opening the Gate*: within the human body are twenty-seven lords of life-*qi*: the hair is the *Azure City Lord*, the head the *Three Terraces Lord*, the eyebrows the *Eight Poles Lord*, the left eye the *Gazing Clarity Lord*, the right eye the *Mysterious Clarity Lord*, the left ear the *Hearing Clarity Lord*, the right ear the *Decisive Clarity Lord*, the nose the *Lord of the Wondrous Gate of the Celestial Circuit*, the mouth the *Jade Gate Lord*, the lips the *Jade Portal Lord*, the teeth the *Twenty-Eight Primordial Officers Lord*, the tongue the *Limitless Lord*, the throat the *Colonel Lord*, the larynx the *Nine Ministers Lord*, the liver the *Crimson Palace Lord*, the lungs the *Floral Canopy Lord*, the gallbladder the *Longevity Lord*, the heart the *Cinnabar Field Lord*, the navel the *Purple-White Lord*, the stomach the *Great Granary Lord*, the spleen the *Yellow Court Lord*, the left kidney the *Mysterious Wondrous Lord*, the right kidney the *Primal Upright Lord*, the large intestine the *Nourishing Mother Lord*, the small intestine the *Dao-Conducting Lord*, the intestines the *Guardian of the Dao Lord*, the *Triple Burner* the *Mysterious Foremost Lord*, the left thigh the *Small Chariot Lord*, the right thigh the *Wandering Lord*, the left foot the *Thunder and Lightning Lord*, and the right foot the *Cloud and Qi Lord*. These twenty-seven lords of life-*qi* should always remain concealed within the body’s armor; they must not be recklessly revealed.

If counted in detail, there are thirty-one lords, but the specifics are unclear.

chunks.original_text: 二十八中法门各数品 二十八宿者，按《三皇三十二天斋仪》云：北方东壁营室危虚须女牵牛南斗也，东方箕尾心房氏亢角也，南方轸翼张星柳鬼井也，西方参觜毕昴胃娄奎也，四方各七，合成二十八。 人修三皇斋，请二十八宿以释天罗地网，基谪增延年等也。 《谢五墓醮仪》云：东方七宿者，角亢氏房心尾箕； 南方七宿者，井鬼柳星张翼轸； 西方七宿者，奎娄胃昴毕觜参； 北方七宿者，斗牛女虚危室璧。 凡人家四十六世以来有咒诅盘结者，此二十八宿能为人解而散之。 《度星经》云：东方角宿，字君帝，亢宿字君明，氏宿，字君上，房宿字、君真，心宿字君贞，尾宿字君利，箕宿字君长。 北方斗宿字君子，牛宿字君居，女宿字君陈，虚宿字君通，危宿字君参，室宿字君王，璧宿字君婴。 西方奎宿字君时，娄宿字君利，胃宿字君明，昴 宿字君玉，毕宿字君进，觜宿字君明，参宿字君成。 南方井宿字君节，鬼宿字君居，柳宿字君迁，星宿字君明，张宿字君府，翼宿字君信，轸宿字君乾。 皆能传送亡人，不令复连后生之人也。 前文二十四治山中，亦俱列此名字讫。 三十二中法门名数品 三十二天者，按依如《无量度人经》云，又《内音玉字下》云：一曰太黄皇曾天，去太明玉完天九亿九万炁，今释云一气有九万九千九百九十重。 二曰太明玉完天，去何童天八亿万气。 三曰清明何童天，去平育天七亿万气。 四曰玄胎平育天，去文举天六亿万气。 五曰元明文举天，去摩夷决五亿万气。 六曰上明七曜摩夷天，去越衡天四亿万气。 《太真科中卷》云：为欲界天，阴阳有欲，交接胎生，积万岁也。 《义渊》上云：持十戒口业净者，登欲界； 身业净，登色界； 心业净，登无色界； 入九品行者，登种民天也。 此之次位，已录在前三中名数品之中，三业内文也。 《内音》云：七曰虚无越衡天，去蒙医天三亿万气。 八曰太极蒙医天。 去和阳天二亿万气。 右八天属东方始青之气。 九曰赤明和阳天，去恭华天九千万气。 十曰玄明恭华天，去宗飘天八千万气。 十一曰耀明宗飘天，去皇茄天七千万气。 十二曰竺落皇茄天，去堂耀天六千万气。 十三曰虚明堂耀天，去端靖天五千万气。 十四曰观明端靖天，去恭庆天四千万气。 十五曰玄明恭庆天，去极瑶天三千万气。 十六曰太焕极瑶天。 去孔升天二千万气。 右八天分度属南方赤天。 十七曰元载孔升天，去皇崖天九百万气。 十八曰太安皇崖天，去极风天八百万气。 十九曰显定极风天，去孝芒天七百万气。 二十曰始皇孝芒天，去翁重天六百万气。 二十一曰大皇访重天，去江由天五百万气。 二十二曰无思江由天，去阮乐天四百万气。 二十三曰上揲阮乐天，去昙誓天三百万气。 二十四曰无极昙誓天。 去霄度天二百万气。 右八天分度属西方素天。 二十五曰皓庭霄度天，去元洞天九万九千气。 二十六曰渊通元洞天，去妙成天八万八千气。 二十七曰翰宠妙成天。 去禁上天七万七千气。 《太真科中卷》云：此十八天为色界，与欲界同。 阴阳有形，不相交接，人皆化生，所啖香味，无复便旋，年积亿岁，不夭不伤也。 二十八曰秀乐禁上天，去常融天六万六千气。 二十九曰无上常融天，去玉际天五万五千气。

The Twenty-Eight Methods of the Central Gates, Each with Its Own Categories

The twenty-eight constellations, as recorded in *The Thirty-Two Heavenly Fast Rites of the Three Sovereigns*, are as follows: the northern quadrant comprises Dongbi, Yingshi, Wei, Xu, Xunu, Qianniu, and Nandou; the eastern quadrant comprises Ji, Wei, Xin, Fang, Di, Kang, and Jiao; the southern quadrant comprises Zhen, Yi, Zhang, Xing, Liu, Gui, and Jing; the western quadrant comprises Shen, Zi, Bi, Mao, Wei, Lou, and Kui. Each quadrant contains seven, totaling twenty-eight.

When one observes the fast of the Three Sovereigns, one invokes the twenty-eight constellations to dissolve the celestial nets and terrestrial webs, to alleviate karmic retribution, and to prolong life.

*The Rites of the Five Tombs Offering* states: the seven constellations of the eastern quadrant are Jiao, Kang, Di, Fang, Xin, Wei, and Ji; the seven constellations of the southern quadrant are Jing, Gui, Liu, Xing, Zhang, Yi, and Zhen; the seven constellations of the western quadrant are Kui, Lou, Wei, Mao, Bi, Zi, and Shen; the seven constellations of the northern quadrant are Dou, Niu, Nü, Xu, Wei, Shi, and Bi. For households with curses or entanglements spanning forty-six generations, these twenty-eight constellations possess the power to resolve and disperse them.

*The Scripture of Stellar Liberation* states: the eastern constellation Jiao is named Lord Di; Kang, Lord Ming; Di, Lord Shang; Fang, Lord Zhen; Xin, Lord Zheng; Wei, Lord Li; Ji, Lord Chang. The northern constellation Dou is named Lord Zi; Niu, Lord Ju; Nü, Lord Chen; Xu, Lord Tong; Wei, Lord Can; Shi, Lord Wang; Bi, Lord Ying. The western constellation Kui is named Lord Shi; Lou, Lord Li; Wei, Lord Ming; Mao, Lord Yu; Bi, Lord Jin; Zi, Lord Ming; Shen, Lord Cheng. The southern constellation Jing is named Lord Jie; Gui, Lord Ju; Liu, Lord Qian; Xing, Lord Ming; Zhang, Lord Fu; Yi, Lord Xin; Zhen, Lord Qian. All these constellations can transmit and deliver the deceased, preventing them from entangling future generations. The names of these constellations were also listed among the twenty-four sacred mountains in the preceding text.

The Thirty-Two Methods of the Central Gates, with Their Names and Categories

The thirty-two heavens, as recorded in *The Scripture of Limitless Salvation* and *The Inner Sounds of Jade Characters Below*, are as follows:

1. **Taihuang Huangzeng Heaven**, separated from Taiming Yuwan Heaven by ninety-nine myriad and nine thousand *qi*. Modern exegesis states that one *qi* comprises ninety-nine thousand nine hundred and ninety layers.
2. **Taiming Yuwan Heaven**, separated from Hetong Heaven by eighty myriad *qi*.
3. **Qingming Hetong Heaven**, separated from Pingyu Heaven by seventy myriad *qi*.
4. **Xuantai Pingyu Heaven**, separated from Wenju Heaven by sixty myriad *qi*.
5. **Yuanming Wenju Heaven**, separated from Moyi Jue Heaven by fifty myriad *qi*.
6. **Shangming Qiyao Moyi Heaven**, separated from Yueheng Heaven by forty myriad *qi*.

*The Central Scroll of the Supreme Perfection Regulations* states: these are the heavens of the Desire Realm, where yin and yang commingle, beings are born of wombs, and lifespans accumulate to ten thousand years.

*The Profound Meaning* states: those who uphold the ten precepts and purify their verbal karma ascend to the Desire Realm; those who purify their physical karma ascend to the Form Realm; those who purify their mental karma ascend to the Formless Realm; those who enter the nine grades of practice ascend to the Heaven of Seed People. These ranks were previously recorded in the "Three Categories of Names and Numbers" under the section on the three karmas.

*The Inner Sounds* states:
7. **Xuwu Yueheng Heaven**, separated from Mengyi Heaven by thirty myriad *qi*.
8. **Taiji Mengyi Heaven**, separated from Heyang Heaven by twenty myriad *qi*.

These eight heavens belong to the eastern quadrant, governed by the Qi of Beginning Azure.

9. **Chiming Heyang Heaven**, separated from Gonghua Heaven by ninety million *qi*.
10. **Xuanming Gonghua Heaven**, separated from Zongpiao Heaven by eighty million *qi*.
11. **Yaoming Zongpiao Heaven**, separated from Huangjia Heaven by seventy million *qi*.
12. **Zhuluo Huangjia Heaven**, separated from Tangyao Heaven by sixty million *qi*.
13. **Xuming Tangyao Heaven**, separated from Duanjing Heaven by fifty million *qi*.

15. **Xuanming Gongqing Heaven**, separated from Jiyao Heaven by thirty million *qi*.
16. **Taihuan Jiyao Heaven**, separated from Kongsheng Heaven by twenty million *qi*.

These eight heavens belong to the southern quadrant, governed by the Crimson Heaven.

17. **Yuanzai Kongsheng Heaven**, separated from Huangya Heaven by nine million *qi*.
18. **Tai’an Huangya Heaven**, separated from Jifeng Heaven by eight million *qi*.
19. **Xianding Jifeng Heaven**, separated from Xiaomang Heaven by seven million *qi*.
20. **Shihuang Xiaomang Heaven**, separated from Wengchong Heaven by six million *qi*.
21. **Dahuang Fangchong Heaven**, separated from Jiangyou Heaven by five million *qi*.
22. **Wusi Jiangyou Heaven**, separated from Ruanle Heaven by four million *qi*.
23. **Shangdie Ruanle Heaven**, separated from Tanshi Heaven by three million *qi*.
24. **Wuji Tanshi Heaven**, separated from Xiaodu Heaven by two million *qi*.

These eight heavens belong to the western quadrant, governed by the White Heaven.

25. **Haoting Xiaodu Heaven**, separated from Yuandong Heaven by ninety-nine thousand *qi*.
26. **Yuantong Yuandong Heaven**, separated from Miaocheng Heaven by eighty-eight thousand *qi*.
27. **Hanchong Miaocheng Heaven**, separated from Jinshang Heaven by seventy-seven thousand *qi*.

*The Central Scroll of the Supreme Perfection Regulations* states: these eighteen heavens constitute the Form Realm, akin to the Desire Realm. Though yin and yang possess form, they do not commingle; beings are born through transformation, partake of fragrant essences, and do not excrete waste. Their lifespans accumulate to billions of years, free from premature death or harm.

28. **Xiule Jin Shang Heaven**, separated from Changrong Heaven by sixty-six thousand *qi*.
29. **Wushang Changrong Heaven**, separated from Yuji Heaven by fifty-five thousand *qi*.

chunks.original_text: 三十曰玉隆腾胜天，去梵度天四万四千气。 三十一曰龙变梵度天，去贾奕天三万三千气。 三十二曰平育贾奕天。 去梵行之气一万二千气。 右八天之气分度属北方玄天。 《太真科中卷》云：此为四种民天，学真堪为人种，王母迎之。 登上四天者，名曰梵行，虽危不败，安诸种人，不堕三涂，方游三清也。 《业报经》中真说之，已录在前四中名数例四种人天文内讫也，及在三界名例文内也。 若作四方分者，方有八天，四八成三十二天。 若三界分者，即如下文所云。 宋文明《道德义渊上》所说者，此三十二天．则专主人福果，异乎九天及三十六天。 福果由於业行，业行起六根，眼、耳、鼻、口、身、心也。 於口业能伏身心等，则随功次第生欲界六天。 六天者，从太黄天至上明天为六天也。 於六根中有犹入前尘者，有缘尘而不入者，有渐不复缘入者，凡三种。 三六为十八，则生色界十八天。 十八天者，从虚无越衡天至无极昙誓天，为十八天也。 六根都不复缘入者，则生无色界四天。 四天者，从皓庭天至秀乐天，凡四天是也。 所以止四天者，六根并净，但有仁义礼智，唯四天故也。 若是信者，属於道境，故不生三界也。 此都合二十八天为三界也。 虽伏而未断，习气未除，未能忘想，故未得长存，犹在三界，寿尽则坏随行所之也。 上从常融天至贾奕天，为四天，号东华、南极、西灵、北真四宫，洞入道境，为世种民天，下随劫坏，就前二十八天为三十二天也。 《义渊下》又疑曰：太上五德，同在一分，唯取一信，将非矛盾之耶？ 答曰：五德悉属太上，而云信属於道不生三界者，非言四德都不属於道，正言缘三界而升了，信所以不缘三界者，经云：其精甚真，其中有信也。 隐注云：学道由丹信，信为行本，直登三清。 仁义礼智，即道之德。 缘次而至，无异大戒。 备五德而犹独称智慧也。 合通而言之，则五德皆道也。 《宝玄经》亦云：上德同天，还与道合。 别而为语，则一信属道也，四行属德，无异。 《易》云：立天之道，曰阴与阳； 立地之道，曰柔与刚。 而复言：天阳地阴，乾刚坤柔。 《玉诀》云：天无灵宝，无以得生； 地无灵宝，无以得成。 而复云：生天立地上谓之灵，施镇五岳下谓之宝。 又云：在天曰灵，在地曰宝。 合离通别，多如此例，识沉心忘，或非矛盾也。 宋文明《灵宝杂问》云：三界三十二天，依如《灵宝内音》，分置在四方。 《定志经图》正作三重。 今义疏中解释云：如羊角而上。 与二事并违，何邪？ 答曰：此乃所以二事两通也。 羊角者，犹庄子之义也。 敷斋威仪太极真人云：庄子是南华仙人，故其可据羊角则如肠道周回而上。 上者转高，此是重累，亦是遍四方也。 《玄门论第二十》云：三十六天，还是三清妙境，虽复位居界表，变化难思。 小则存入三宫，大则远超六合，皆是圣应所分，开化接引，通论此气，非阴非阳，玄绝清梵也。 次此已下，按《灵宝经》以三十二天往明三界，故《度人经》云：元纲流演三十二天。 其三十二天并在空无之中，周回，十方，起自东北，扶摇台羊角而上。 今依《本元经》，配方如左： 第一太黄皇曾天气，系西北方梵气。 第二太明玉完天气，系璧宿。

30. **Yulong Tengsheng Heaven**, separated from Fandu Heaven by forty-four thousand *qi*.
31. **Longbian Fandu Heaven**, separated from Jiayi Heaven by thirty-three thousand *qi*.
32. **Pingyu Jiayi Heaven**, separated from the *qi* of Brahmā-conduct by twelve thousand *qi*.

The *qi* divisions of these eight heavens belong to the Dark Heaven of the North.

*The Central Scroll of the Supreme Perfection Regulations* states: these constitute the Four Kinds of Human Heavens, where those who study the Dao may become seeds of humanity. The Queen Mother welcomes them. Those who ascend to the upper four heavens are called *Brahmā-conduct*; though perilous, they do not fail. They pacify all kinds of people, do not fall into the Three Wretched Realms, and may roam the Three Clarities.

As the *Sutra of Karmic Retribution* truly expounds, this has already been recorded in the previous section on the four kinds of human and heavenly beings, as well as in the section on the names of the Three Realms. If divided by the four directions, each direction has eight heavens, and four times eight makes thirty-two heavens. If divided by the Three Realms, it follows the arrangement below.

Song Wenming’s *Profound Meaning of the Dao and Its Virtue* states that these thirty-two heavens specifically govern the fruits of fortune, differing from the Nine Heavens and the Thirty-Six Heavens. The fruits of fortune arise from karmic actions, and karmic actions originate from the six roots: eye, ear, nose, mouth, body, and mind. If the mouth’s karma can subdue the body and mind, one ascends to the six heavens of the Desire Realm in accordance with merit. The six heavens are from Taihuang Heaven to Shangming Heaven.

Among the six roots, some still engage with sensory objects, some are conditioned by objects but do not engage, and some gradually no longer condition or engage—altogether three kinds. Three times six makes eighteen, thus giving rise to the eighteen heavens of the Form Realm. The eighteen heavens are from Xuwu Yueheng Heaven to Wuji Tanshi Heaven. When the six roots no longer condition or engage at all, one is born in the four heavens of the Formless Realm. The four heavens are from Haoting Heaven to Xiule Heaven. The reason there are only four heavens is that the six roots are all purified, leaving only benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and wisdom—hence four heavens. Those who have faith belong to the realm of the Dao and are not born in the Three Realms.

Altogether, these twenty-eight heavens constitute the Three Realms. Though subdued, if not severed, residual habits remain, and thoughts are not forgotten; thus, one does not attain eternal existence and still resides in the Three Realms. When lifespan ends, one perishes and follows the path of their actions.

From Changrong Heaven to Jiayi Heaven are four heavens, called the Four Palaces of Donghua, Nanji, Xiling, and Beizhen. They penetrate the realm of the Dao and serve as the heavens of the seeds of the world. Below, they follow the kalpic destruction, combining with the previous twenty-eight heavens to make thirty-two heavens.

*Profound Meaning, Lower Scroll* further queries: the Five Virtues of the Supreme One all reside in one division, yet only faith is said to belong to the Dao and not be born in the Three Realms—is this not contradictory? The answer is: the Five Virtues all belong to the Supreme One. Saying that faith belongs to the Dao and does not condition the Three Realms does not mean the other four virtues do not belong to the Dao. It simply means that through conditioning the Three Realms, one ascends and transcends. Faith does not condition the Three Realms because, as the scripture states: "Its essence is most true, and within it is faith." The hidden commentary says: studying the Dao depends on cinnabar faith; faith is the foundation of practice, leading directly to the Three Clarities. Benevolence, righteousness, propriety, and wisdom are the virtues of the Dao. They arise in sequence, no different from the Great Precepts. When all Five Virtues are complete, wisdom alone is singled out for praise. Speaking comprehensively, the Five Virtues are all the Dao.

The *Treasure Mystery Sutra* also states: "The highest virtue is equal to Heaven and returns to unite with the Dao." Speaking separately, faith alone belongs to the Dao, while the other four belong to virtue—no difference. The *Book of Changes* says: "The Way of Heaven is called yin and yang; the Way of Earth is called soft and hard." Yet it also says: "Heaven is yang, Earth is yin; Qian is hard, Kun is soft." The *Jade Explanation* states: "Without the Numinous Treasure, Heaven cannot be born; without the Numinous Treasure, Earth cannot be completed." Yet it also says: "Above, establishing Heaven and Earth is called *ling*; below, stabilizing the Five Peaks is called *bao*." And again: "In Heaven it is called *ling*; on Earth it is called *bao*." Such examples of synthesis and separation, unity and distinction, are many. If one’s mind is sunk in oblivion, it may not seem contradictory.

Song Wenming’s *Miscellaneous Questions on the Numinous Treasure* states: the Three Realms and thirty-two heavens, according to the *Inner Sound of the Numinous Treasure*, are arranged in the four directions. The *Sutra of Resolute Mind and Its Diagram* presents them as three layers. Yet the present commentary explains them as ascending like a ram’s horns—contradicting both. Why? The answer is: this is how both can be reconciled. The ram’s horns follow Zhuangzi’s meaning. The *Ritual of the Grand Ultimate Perfected* by Fuzhai says: Zhuangzi was the Immortal of Nanhua, so his analogy of ram’s horns can be trusted. Like the intestines’ winding path, it spirals upward. The higher it turns, the loftier it becomes—this is layering, and it also encompasses the four directions.

The *Discourse on the Mysterious Gate, Scroll 20* states: the Thirty-Six Heavens are still the wondrous realm of the Three Clarities. Though their positions lie beyond the realms, their transformations are unfathomable. In small measure, they enter the Three Palaces; in great measure, they transcend the Six Directions. All are the divisions of the sagely response, opening and guiding, transforming and receiving. Speaking of this *qi*, it is neither yin nor yang—profoundly transcendent and pure.

Below this, following the *Numinous Treasure Sutra*, the thirty-two heavens are used to illustrate the Three Realms. Thus, the *Sutra of Salvation* says: "The primordial net flows forth through the thirty-two heavens." These thirty-two heavens all reside in the Void, revolving through the ten directions, rising from the northeast on the whirlwind terrace like ram’s horns. Now, according to the *Sutra of the Original Source*, the directional correspondences are as follows:

1. The *qi* of **Taihuang Huangzeng Heaven**, belonging to the northwest, is the *qi* of Brahmā.
2. The *qi* of **Taiming Yuwan Heaven**, belonging to the Eastern Wall constellation.

chunks.original_text: 第三清明何童天气，系室宿。 第四玄胎平育天气，系危宿。 第五元明文举天气，系虚宿。 第六上明七曜天气，系女宿。 第七虚无越衡天气，系牛宿。 第八太极蒙翳天气，系斗宿。 右八天位在东方木数，纳音九，故总为九气，青气系北方七宿。 第九赤明和阳天气，系东北方梵气。 第十玄明恭华天，箕宿。 第十一耀明宗飘天，尾宿。 第十二竺落皇笳天，心宿。 第十三虚明堂曜天，房宿。 第十四观明端靖天，氏宿。 第十五玄明恭庆天，亢宿。 第十六太焕极瑶天，角宿。 右八天位在南方火数，纳音三，故总为三气丹天，系东方七宿也。 第十七元载孔升天，系东南梵气。 第十八太安皇崖天，轸宿。 第十九显定极风天，翼宿。 第二十始皇孝芒天，张宿。 第二十一太黄翁重浮容天，星宿。 第二十二无思江由天，柳宿。 第二十三上揲阮乐天，鬼宿。 第二十四无极昙誓天，井宿。 右八天，位在西方金数，纳音七，故总为七气素天，系南方七宿。 第二十五皓庭霄度天气，系西南方梵气。 第二十六渊通元洞天，参宿。 第二十七太文翰宠妙成天，觜宿。 第二十八太素秀乐禁上天，毕宿。 第二十九太虚无上常融天，勖宿。 第三十太释玉隆腾胜天，胃宿。 第三十一龙变梵度天，娄宿。 第三十二太极平育贾奕天，奎宿。 右八天位在北方水数，纳音五，故总为五气玄天。 中央土数，纳音一，一以总四方，故不别置。 又仰三清以为中止也。 此三十二天运行不息气系者，阳动於阴，阴动於阳也。 三十二天以次差驰，旋方而上，羊角道周，仍登梵行入三清也。 《隐注宝诀》云：玄阶兴扶摇台在东北方，玄天也，兴起也，言天阶起发於扶摇也。 又《内音》及五炼生尸，皆罗三十二位，施置四方。 今聊依此文，一途往说也。 问人属天何不属太黄皇曾、赤明和阳、元载孔升、皓庭霄度等四维天耶？ 答曰：维中无宿故。 《老君圣纪第十卷》伪惑品云：此即玉清境、元始天尊位在三十五天之上也。 又云：大至真尊圣纪云：此即上清境太上大道君，位在三十四天之上也。 又云：大清境、太极宫，即太上老君位在三十三天之上也。 又云：佛者，西胡得道，位在三十天延真宫主，此即罽宾王是也。 三十二帝者 按《无量度人经》云：一曰郁舰玉明，二曰须阿那田，三曰元育齐京，四曰刘度内鲜，五曰丑法轮，六曰恬懀延，七曰正定光，八日曲育九昌，九曰理禁上真，十曰空瑶丑音，十一曰重光明，十二曰摩夷妙辩，十三曰阿迦娄生，十四曰郁密罗千，十五曰龙罗菩提，十六曰宛黎无延，十七曰开真定光，十八曰婆娄阿贪，十九曰招真童，二十曰萨罗娄王，二十一曰闵巴狂，二十二曰明梵光，二十三曰勃勃监，二十四曰飘弩穹隆，二十五曰慧觉昏，二十六曰梵行观生，二十七曰那育丑瑛，二十八曰龙罗觉长，二十九曰总监鬼神，三十曰眇眇行元，三十一曰运上玄玄，三十二曰大择法门。 通前三十二天，并是诸天隐讳、诸天隐名者也。 四方 各配八天、八帝，四八所以为三十二天、三十二帝。 三十二牢狱者 按《赵文和传》云：三天曹门下狱，北极司录门下狱，北辰主命门下狱，将军太岁门下狱，太阴太阳门下狱，司空土府门下狱，五部土公门下狱，宅中真官门下狱，诸寒温灶君譬狱，东岳太山东门下狱，南岳衡山南门下狱，西岳华山西门下狱，北岳恒山北门下狱，中央嵩山中门下狱，二十八宿

These thirty-two heavens revolve ceaselessly, their *qi* systems governed by the interplay of yang moving within yin and yin moving within yang. The thirty-two heavens ascend in sequence, spiraling upward along the ram’s-horn path, ultimately ascending through the Dao-conduct to enter the Three Clarities.

The *Hidden Commentary on the Treasure Formula* states: "The Mysterious Staircase arises from the Whirlwind Terrace in the northeast—this is the Mysterious Heaven, the origin of ascent, signifying the celestial staircase emerging from the whirlwind." Additionally, the *Inner Tone* and the *Five Refinements of the Corpse* both array the thirty-two positions, distributing them across the four directions. Here, we briefly follow this text as one interpretive path.

**Question:** Why are humans attributed to the heavens but not to the four corner heavens—**Taihuang Huangzeng**, **Chiming Heyang**, **Yuanzai Kongsheng**, and **Haoting Xiaodu**?

**Chapter on Auspicious Marks**
*The Original Record of the Supreme Perfected’s Primordial Birth and Transformations* states:
The Primordial Venerable of the Supreme Elder wears upon his head a nine-colored cloud of cinnabar brocade, a hundred-changing radiance of cinnabar and purple clouds, and rides a nine-colored dragon.

It is also said:
The Venerable Elder of the Three Heavens bears twelve auspicious wheels upon his neck and possesses the hue of yellow gold.

*The Inner Secrets of the Nine Perfected of the Supreme Clarity* states:
The Yellow Elder of the Center shines with layered solar brilliance, his connected light illuminating the void. His canopy is woven of five clouds, his fragrant smoke profound and pure.

*The Scripture of the Lesser Kalpa* states:
His entire body is of yellow gold, his neck encircled by a seven-jeweled halo. His feet tread upon lotus blossoms as he walks.

*The Natural Rites of Laozi* states:
Laozi said: The Dao is present in all things. Jade countenance and golden form transcend the heavens, revered by both gods and humans—this is the object of meditative contemplation.

*The Scripture of the Three Dao’s Sequential Practices* states:
The essence of the seven treasures transforms into the seven stars, and the seven youths possess the purple radiance of the seven luminaries.

*The Scripture of the Great Kalpa* states:
The White-Yellow Lord entered a cave and beheld a perfected one, his light canopy resplendent. His form stood sixteen feet tall, his neck encircled by a halo, his entire body clad in seven-jeweled raiment.

It is also said:
The Supreme Sovereign of the Supreme Antiquity, the Perfected One, bears seventy-two marks and eighty-one excellences.

It is further said:
His hands radiate the six perfections, his demeanor profound and smiling, his excellences complete.

*The Scripture of the Feminine One and the Five Elders* states:
The Primordial Yellow Lady of the Yellow Plain, whose taboo name is *Round Flower Yellow Blade* and whose style is *Supreme Zhang*, possesses a form of yellow-golden substance.

*The Scripture of the Three Sovereigns* states:
The people of the northern lands have hair of dark azure hue and stand eight feet tall.

*The Scripture of the Eight Effulgences* states:
Those who ingest the divine elixir of descending life sprout nine morning lights upon their heads, their faces adorned with jade blossoms, their flight mirrored in jeweled radiance.

*The Twenty-Four Images of Life* states:
The flying immortals possess universal golden countenances.

The commentary on *The Jade Scripture of the Great Cavern, Thirty-Nine Chapters* states:
The Golden Immortals are those whose immortal hue and form gleam like golden light.

*The Scripture of Laozi’s Sixteen Transformations* states:
At the first transformation, he was born in the east, his body azure. His compassionate father’s surname was *Sea*, his mother’s *River*.
At the third transformation, his body bore thirty-six colors of brocade patterns.
At the fourth transformation, his forehead displayed the three yangs, his recumbent moon twelve lines, and his hands, though not open, grasped the patterns of scripture.

*The Lower Section of the Precepts of the Supreme Perfected* states:
The Jade Emperor of the Golden Gates of the Supreme Void, most revered and noble, neither born nor dying, abides in serene constancy. His jade countenance and golden form possess wondrous marks beyond compare.

*The Fifth of the Ten Latitudinal Scriptures of the Five Thousand Words* states:
The Heavenly Worthy emitted the luminous pearl from between his brows, illuminating all under heaven.

*The Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:
The Eastern King of Jade Clarity and Primordial Radiance, the Immortal Duke, is titled the Jade Sovereign Dao Lord. His neck bears a halo, his body emits jeweled effulgences, bright as the morning sun. In his hands he holds a flowing bell, his feet tread the seven primals. He gazes upward to the Supreme Origin and points downward to the boundless void.

*The Meaning of the Eight Difficulties in the Nine Chapters* states:
The auspicious marks of the various heavens include long eyebrows and high ears, a prominent nose and square pupils, azure kidneys with striated patterns, and a cinnabar heart with brocade-like lungs.
The inauspicious marks of the base include a crane’s back and tortoise’s breast, a hawk’s head and deer’s face, a fish’s mouth and bird’s beak, a goat’s nose and horse’s cheeks, a deer’s neck and pheasant’s sinews, a duck’s feet and pig’s hooves.

*The Meaning of the Immortal Marks in the Nine Chapters* states:
Azure liver and purple veins, azure kidneys with striated patterns.
Those with the *River Chariot* on their backs bear a black mark shaped like the Northern Dipper.
Those with four pupils in their eyes possess square pupils and round vision.
Those with three palates in their teeth have blade-like palates, their teeth and molars each bearing three-peaked edges.
Those with a thousand paired lines at their brow corners possess patterns of a thousand pairs rising toward the head.
Those with *sequential patterns forming ramparts* use their eyes as city walls, each with horizontal lines following the eyes.
Those with *hidden morning light behind the ears* have bones protruding behind their ears, visible externally, called *hidden morning light*.

The immortal Liu Jing said:
Those with square pupils in their eyes are people of a thousand years.

*The Scripture of the Immeasurable* states:
Their jade pupils shine brilliantly.

*The Third Scripture of the Fundamental Kalpa* states:
The Supreme Dao Lord of the Highest clacked his teeth and smiled, and a nine-jeweled radiance issued from his face, illuminating the Celestial Master’s body. He exhaled a soft voice to address the Celestial Master.

*The Pearl Instructions and Jade Tablets*, along with *The Western Ascent*, *The Womb of Returning Destiny*, and *The Inner Scripture of the Golden Tablet*, describe Laozi’s auspicious marks:
His body stood eight feet and eight inches tall, his complexion yellow. His eyebrows were fine, his ears long, his eyes large, his forehead broad. His teeth were spaced, his mouth square, his lips thick. His forehead bore the three and five penetrating principles. His temples displayed the sun’s corner and the moon’s suspension. His nose had a double ridge, his ears three openings. His feet trod the two and five, his hands grasped the ten patterns.

*The Esoteric Wondrous Chapters* state:
The Mysterious Wondrous Jade Maiden dreamed of a shooting star entering her mouth, whereupon she conceived. After eighty-one years, she gave birth to Laozi.

*The Scripture of the Supreme Origin* states:
Li’s mother, reclining during the day, saw a five-colored pearl the size of a pellet descend from the heavens. She swallowed it and immediately conceived.

chunks.original_text: 《老子十净供经》云：真人三十二相、八十种好，项负圆光，光皆五色，显照净明也。 《太玄部第八》云：转轮得神仙，缘我改心精。 受报无穷量，志定入福庭。 三十二相好，皆从身中明。 项负七宝光，照曜诸天形。 《九章》云：天尊面放五明之色。 释云：五种智慧之光，欲救五道众生。 亦云五德之威光，亦云欲照五方国土也。 《神仙传第二》云：若土之相也，深目而玄准，准者鼻也。 鸢肩而长颈，丰上而杀下也。 彭祖之相者，面生异骨，体有奇毛。 《神仙传第三》云：王远，字方平，黄色，少须，长短中人也。 又仙人麻姑，侍从女子可年十八九，於头中作髻，余发散垂之可至腰也。 《神仙传第四》云：太阳女者，色如桃花，口如含丹，肌理光泽，发肤有如十七八者。 太阳子者，虽鬓发斑白而肌肤丰盛，面目光华也。 太阴女者，饮神光之水，身登王子之魁，体有五行之宝芝也。 又孙登者，止山穴间，被发自覆，发长一丈许。 《神仙传第六》云：八公化成十五童子，露髻青彩，色如桃华也。 《神仙传第七》云：刘根者，字君安，京兆长安人。 深目多须发，须发皆黄，长二四寸也。 身毛长一二尺。 《神仙传第十》云：李根，字子源，两目童子皆正方也。 按《仙经》云：八百岁童子方也。 东郭延年者，山阳人也，服灵飞散能夜书，在暝室中身生光，光照左右也。 《登真隐诀立功品》云：生而青骨，通神接真。 《上清六甲内经》云：六甲旬中，玉女并颓云三角之髻，余发散垂下至腰也。 《无量变生经》云：太上身体金色，面有紫光也。 《太洞玉诀》云：金华仙人饮流霞之水，则五藏明彻，面生紫云。 汉武帝《洞冥记》云：仙人边伯子，食海中菱芰，骨轻，身生毛羽也。 边字或作凫字也。 《上清命魔经》云：太保真人，足排七度，手乘天机，颠盖玄辰，合逮二仪。 《八素经》云：服日月之精者，体映玉光，面发金真。 又云：面有玉泽，体生金光。 又云：面有金容，头生紫光。 又云：项生紫光，面发金容。 又云：三门启机，九户受灵。 面发金容，五藏华荣。 金真咸畅，豁落洞明。 神灼潜照，宝光夜生。 《三九素语玉精真诀》云：面发金容，五内华生，玉藏保气，神仙道成。 《玉帝七圣玄纪》云：西华之女，金晨之童，曜云姿於琼侧，含金容於兰房。 又云：神奇异毛，紫胞玉络也。 又云：流精紫光，内映外缠，宝藏金容。 《三元玉检经》云：紫素元君，头建太真晨婴之冠，三角髻，余发散之垂腰也。 又云：金骨玉髓，玄名帝图也。 《三道顺行经》云：通身光明，面生青晖之精也。 《飞天纲步地纪经》云：西灵神童，面有玉华也。 又云：南真灵妃，紫灵娇女，面有金碧龙华也。 又云：关令尹喜，项生宝明之光，七十二相映照一形。 又云：尹喜心结紫络，面有圆明，项带承天，背负七元也。 《老子杂说》云：尹喜眼有日精，姿形长雅，垂臂下膝，堂堂有天人之貌。 又云：头负圆耀，五藏有文，面有七星，上象天文，下顺地理，莫不备足也。 《金根经》云：青要帝君，面发金容，体生灵符，七十二色洞映玉形，三晨缠络，六气齐并。 又云：金骸玉骨，名书帝箓。 又云：面有玉精，体生紫光。 又云：太阳女，面生金光也。

*The Scripture of the Ten Pure Offerings to Laozi* states:
The Perfected One possessed the thirty-two marks and eighty excellences. His nape bore a halo of radiance, its light in five colors, luminous and resplendently pure.

*The Eighth Scroll of the Supreme Mystery* states:
Turning the wheel, one attains divine transcendence,
For I refine the essence of the heart.
Receiving boundless retribution,
With resolve fixed, one enters the court of fortune.
The thirty-two marks and eighty excellences
All shine forth from within the body.
His nape bears the seven-jeweled light,
Illumining the forms of all heavens.

*The Nine Chapters* states:
The Heavenly Worthy’s face emitted the five luminous hues.
The commentary explains: the five kinds of wisdom-light, to save the beings of the five destinies. It is also called the majestic radiance of the five virtues, or the light meant to illumine the lands of the five directions.

*The Second Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
As for the appearance of one born of earth: deep-set eyes and a dark bridge of the nose—the bridge being the nose. Hawk-like shoulders and a long neck, broad above and tapering below.
As for Pengzu’s appearance: his face bore unusual bones, his body extraordinary hairs.

*The Third Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
Wang Yuan, styled Fangping, was of yellow complexion, with scant beard and mustache, of medium height.
Also, the transcendent Ma Gu’s attendant maiden appeared to be about eighteen or nineteen, her hair gathered into a topknot, the rest hanging loose to her waist.

*The Fourth Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
The Maiden of Grand Yang had a complexion like peach blossoms, lips like cinnabar held within, her skin lustrous and radiant, her hair and flesh as though she were seventeen or eighteen.
The Master of Grand Yang, though his temples were streaked with white, had plump, glowing skin and a radiant countenance.
The Maiden of Grand Yin drank the water of divine light, her body ascending to the rank of the Prince’s Eminence, her form bearing the sacred mushrooms of the five phases.
Also, Sun Deng dwelled in mountain caves, his hair grown long enough to cover him, reaching over a *zhang* in length.

*The Sixth Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
The Eight Lords transformed into fifteen youths, their hair unbound and adorned with azure hues, their complexions like peach blossoms.

*The Seventh Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
Liu Gen, styled Jun’an, was a native of Chang’an in Jingzhao. His eyes were deep-set, his beard and hair thick, both yellow and measuring two to four *cun* in length. The hair on his body grew one to two *chi* long.

*The Tenth Scroll of the Traditions of Divine Transcendents* states:
Li Gen, styled Ziyuan, had pupils in both eyes perfectly square.
According to *The Scripture of Transcendents*: at eight hundred years, the pupils become square.
Dongguo Yannian, a native of Shanyang, ingested the *Lingfei* powder and could write at night. In a darkened chamber, his body emitted light, illuminating all around him.

*The Chapter on Establishing Merit in the Hidden Instructions for Ascending Perfection* states:
Born with azure bones, one communes with spirits and joins the Perfected.

*The Inner Scripture of the Six Jia of Supreme Purity* states:
During the ten-day periods of the six Jia, the Jade Maidens all wore three-cornered topknots, the rest of their hair hanging loose to their waists.

*The Scripture of Boundless Transformations and Births* states:
The Most High’s body was golden in color, his face suffused with purple light.

*The Jade Instructions of the Great Cavern* states:
The Golden Flower Transcendent drank the flowing rosy clouds, whereby his five viscera became bright and clear, and his face bore purple clouds.

*The Records of the Deep Mysteries of Han Emperor Wu* states:
The transcendent Bian Bozi ate water caltrops from the sea, his bones grew light, and his body sprouted feathers.
(Note: *Bian* may also be written as *Fu*.)

*The Scripture on Commanding Demons of Supreme Purity* states:
The Perfected Guardian of the Great Treasure set his feet upon the seven measures, grasped the celestial mechanism in his hands, his crown covered the mysterious celestial bodies, and he united with the two primal forces.

*The Scripture of the Eight Simplicities* states:
Those who ingest the essence of the sun and moon have bodies that reflect jade light and faces that emit golden perfection.
It also states: the face has jade luster, the body emits golden light.
It also states: the face has a golden countenance, the head emits purple light.
It also states: the nape emits purple light, the face radiates a golden countenance.
It also states: the three gates open the mechanism, the nine portals receive the numinous. The face emits a golden countenance, the five viscera flourish in splendor. Golden perfection flows freely, the vast expanse is thoroughly illuminated. The spirit blazes with latent radiance, treasure-light arises at night.

*The True Instructions of the Three-Nine Simplicities and Jade Essence* states:
The face emits a golden countenance, the five interiors flourish in splendor. The jade viscera preserve qi, and the Dao of divine transcendence is accomplished.

*The Mysterious Record of the Seven Sages of the Jade Emperor* states:
The Maiden of the Western Florescence, the Youth of the Golden Dawn, displayed cloud-like grace by the jasper side, bearing a golden countenance within the orchid chamber.
It also states: extraordinary hairs of the spirit, purple womb and jade network.
It also states: flowing essence and purple light, inwardly reflecting and outwardly entwining, treasure-hidden golden countenance.

*The Scripture of the Jade Tallies of the Three Origins* states:
The Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity wore the crown of the Great Perfected and Morning Infants, her hair in a three-cornered topknot, the rest hanging loose to her waist.
It also states: golden bones and jade marrow, the mysterious name recorded in the imperial register.

*The Scripture of the Three Dao in Harmonious Progression* states:
The entire body radiates brightness, the face emits the essence of azure brilliance.

*The Scripture of the Celestial Net and the Terrestrial Record of Pacing the Stars* states:
The Divine Youth of the Western Numinosity had a face bearing jade splendor.
It also states: the True Consort of the Southern Numinosity, the Purple Numinous Lovely Maiden, had a face bearing golden and jade dragon splendor.
It also states: the Pass Keeper Yin Xi had a nape emitting treasure-bright light, the seventy-two marks illuminating his single form.
It also states: Yin Xi’s heart was bound with purple networks, his face bore perfect clarity, his nape supported the heavens, and his back bore the Seven Origins.

*The Miscellaneous Sayings of Laozi* states:
Yin Xi’s eyes held the essence of the sun, his bearing was tall and refined, his arms hung down to his knees, his majestic presence was that of a celestial being.
It also states: his head bore a halo of radiance, his five viscera had patterns, his face had seven stars, above mirroring the celestial patterns, below aligning with terrestrial principles, all perfectly complete.

*The Scripture of the Golden Root* states:
The Azure Essentials Emperor Lord had a face emitting a golden countenance, his body bore numinous talismans, seventy-two hues thoroughly illuminating his jade form, the three dawns entwining, the six qi harmonizing as one.
It also states: golden skeleton and jade bones, name inscribed in the imperial register.
It also states: the face had jade essence, the body emitted purple light.
It also states: the Maiden of Grand Yang had a face emitting golden light.

It also states: Jade Numinosity Master’s nape perpetually emitted purple light, illuminating ten *li* in all directions. His two eyes held flowing essence, like dark stars reflecting; his face radiated a golden countenance, shining with empty brightness at night.

*The Scripture of Great Possession, Upper Volume* states: Extraordinary fur and rare substance, golden bones and jade name.

It also states: When the joyous Red Child’s true numen descended, his face emitted jade luster, his body radiated wondrous light, penetrating the subtle and obscure.

*The Scripture of the Eight Gates of the Dark Mother* states: The Left Azure-Silk Primordial Lord, the Right White-Silk Primordial Lord, and the Central Yellow-Silk Primordial Lord each bore a treasure on their napes, their solar qi forming nine-colored circular radiance that brightly illumined the golden-flowered numinous chamber. *The Scripture of the Eight Gates of the Dark Mother* states: The immortal Zhao Chengzi’s face emitted jade light, his dark hair soft and lustrous.

*The Scripture of the Great Cavern, Lower Volume* states: Bones held the jade radiance of the Five Thearchs, the face had flowing golden springs—such were the marks of celestial immortals.

*The Jade Chapters of the Divine Continent* states: The circular flower illumined the great radiance—this was the Central Perfected of the Yellow and Venerable.

*The Commentary on the Jade Scripture of the Great Cavern* states: The immortal’s complexion was like the reflection of golden light.

It also states: Sima Jizhu ingested the flower of bright elixir, drawing in the rosy glow of dawn’s twilight. Having attained the Dao in the Palace of Great Possession, his complexion was like that of a twenty-year-old maiden, his beard three feet long, black as ink.

*The Inner Instructions on the Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected Ones of Highest Purity* states: Those who ingest the *Eight Effulgences, Four Blossoms, Five Pearls, Crimson Life-Generating Elixir* will have their heads emit the light of nine dawns, their faces bear jade flowers that fly and reflect precious luminances, penetratingly observing the world below.

Crush the dregs of the *Eight Effulgences Elixir* and ingest one pellet the size of a small bean each day. The body will emit jade light, lifespan equaling the nine dawns, and the fragrance of one’s body will be detectable thirty *li* away.

*The Scripture of the Great Cavern, Central Volume* states: The Thearch’s single body generated six colors, illuminating the golden radiance and flowing numinous form.

*The Scripture of the Great Cavern of Perfection* states: If one’s body naturally lacks treasure bones and green blood, and the five viscera hold no divine light of gold and jade, then the Dao of the Feminine Unity and the Thearch Unity cannot be heard or seen.

It also states: If the omen of one’s body naturally lacks the vermilion cloud’s liquid, the jade-harmonized qi, emits jade flowers within the Muddy Pellet, or the primordial luxuriance of the Great Plain’s essence within the Crimson Palace; if the jade-forest’s branches do not flourish in the Gate of Destiny, or the nine dancing plumes do not lie prostrate above the Great Ultimate, then *The Scripture of the Great Cavern of Perfection* cannot be heard or seen. If one lacks these marks of excellence, the Highest Thearch will not permit its transmission.

It also states: Nine lights illumined the form, penetratingly shining through the entire body. The body’s five viscera and ten thousand passages were all brightly revealed.

*The Scripture of Transforming the Barbarians* states: Laozi’s body bore the seventy-two marks of adamantine perfection. His hair was dark blue, his face and eyes emitted purple-golden radiance, his face held five-colored light.

*The Scripture of the Seven Stars’ Transference of Degrees* states: May my body generate ten thousand marvels and seventy-two lights, extraordinary fur and rare bones, flying feathered robes. May I ride the void and drive the sky, entering and exiting the imperial palace, with all blessings arriving and infinite longevity.

It also states: When the seventy-two marks of the Ultimate Dao are fully complete, one ascends to heaven in broad daylight. Thus *The Eight Effulgences of the Three Caverns of Numinous Treasure* states: The twenty-four marks of the upper portion are as follows:

First, both eyes hold twin lights;
Second, both brows resemble newly risen twin moons;
Third, hair is dark blue in color;
Fourth, the crown bears a cloud topknot like a purple-gold seal;
Fifth, the head’s crown is fourfold round;
Sixth, the head’s upper portion is round and lower portion square, like a purple-gold mountain;
Seventh, light arises from the celestial center;
Eighth, within the golden-flower division is seven-jeweled light;
Ninth, within the dark cinnabar division are twin celestial pillars;
Tenth, within the Great Sovereign division is a square like a jade seal;
Eleventh, within the Hall of Light division is a circle like a chariot wheel, naturally bearing white down;
Twelfth, within the Cavern Chamber division are red glows and purple networks.

chunks.original_text: 十三者，泥丸分中，金精流液，混合万端； 十四者，两耳如金城郭； 十五者，面如红莲，圆如满月； 十六者，睫如双皇太微； 十七者，两目脸如双月，上弦跟瞳清彻，缓而不瞬； 十八者，两耳后如北斗柄； 十九者，鼻如金柱，具三窗； 二十者，口如丹朱，咽内三处津掖流出，具足无量微妙声音； 二十一者，通骨軿齿； 二十二者，舌有金流，广长覆面； 二十三者，颊如师子，颐如印科； 二十四者，头如天柱，具足三要。 《灵宝三部八景》：二十四相在中分者：一者，心具九孔，孔有九毛； 二者，胸前如重文贝，万辐相轮，字相分明； 三者，正身平立，两手摩膝； 四者，两腋下平满如枢星； 五者，身相如璇玑； 六者，心左如太光宫； 七者，心右如太玄宫； 八者，腹垂如悬盘； 九者，脐如灵宝珠； 十者，脐一具，足三要； 十一者，龙颜凤姿； 十二者，阴相如莲子； 十三者，背平直如腾云； 十四者，背左如东华阙； 十五者，背右如西灵阙； 十六者，坐如蹲龙； 十七者，倚如牵牛； 十八者，行如凤翔； 十九者，髓化成骨，骨如盘龙； 二十者，华颜玉质； 二十一者，金晖紫貌； 二十二者，两乳如□□； 二十三者，两乳下如南辰； 二十四者，通身紫色红晕曜日。 《灵宝三部八景》：二十四相在下分者：一者，两足平满如双轮阙； 二者，两足下具，千辐辋轮相； 三者，两足下策如天河； 四者，两足指长合缦纲具足； 五者，两足下有莲花相轮登； 六者，两足跟具足满好分明； 七者，两足趺高平好与跟相称； 八者，两足踝垣然； 九者，两胫如双柱； 十者，两膊如覆金船； 十一者，一孔一毛，首色柔软右旋； 十二者，两膝珂如魒星； 十三者，两膝内如骞实； 十四者，两膝外如骞花； 十五者，膝上如玉匣； 十六者，股如双玉轴； 十七者，两股内如玉衡； 十八者，两股外如金粱； 十九者，两股上有玉光； 二十者，两股通有双骨如盘龙； 二十一者，金骨玉髓，内外洞见； 二十二者，通身广长，力如金刚； 二十三者，色如紫金，不少不乏； 二十四者，通身明净，洞照十方，多诸智慧，玄觉未然，三界九道，一切苍生，常愿闻见也。 夫大乘万行圆满，具足七十二相，斩来人间，超然白日升天，成无上至道，万仙之宗，众圣之尊。 故《观身智慧大戒经》云：晃晃金刚躯，超超太上仙。 故曰：道中之道，仙中之仙。 《三元经》云：旡顶天巅，元极无穷，普察无量，洞明最上正真，冥寂玄通，大智慧源。 若不具七十二相，皆悉灭度，更寄人间，更修功立德，从微至着，然同七十二相，超然白日成无上道理无二乘，故曰真一元始大道。 故《三元玉检经》云：身洞紫虚，神映金颜。 七十二相，朗曜太空也。 《法轮经》云：身得金刚七十二相，项负圆明，洞映大空，位登高仙。 又云：三十二相好，皆从身中明。 项负七宝光，照曜诸天形。 老子七十二相八十一好者，老子有九变老：第一变，身长六尺六寸，冠鱼鹊冠，八缘凤衣； 第二变，身长七尺七寸，重迭冠，白衣赤领赤袖； 第三变，身长八尺八寸，通天冠，服五彩之衣； 第四变，身长九尺九寸，辟邪冠，服罗桂衣； 第五变，身长一丈三寸，龙蛇冠，着朱光之衣； 第六变，身一丈七寸，虚无冠，着黑毛羽衣；

chunks.original_text: 第七变，身长一丈一尺，元气冠，着龙蛇衣； 第八变，身长一丈一尺五寸，百变冠，服自然衣； 其老子第九变之时，身有七十二相，应七十二气，八十一品也。 七十二相者，头圆法天，顶象昆仑； 伏晨盘郁，玉枕徐起； 皓发如鹤，长余七尺； 虎髭龙髯，素洁如丝； 眉如北斗，色如翠绿； 中有紫毛，长余五寸； 耳无轮廓，中有三门，高平於顶，厚而且坚； 两目镜彻，日精紫光，方童秀朗，规中绿筋； 鼻有双柱，形如截筒； 口方如海，唇如赤丹； 气有紫色，其香若兰； 齿如含贝，其坚若银，数有六八，上下均平； 舌长且广，形如锦文，玉泉充溢，其味甘香，其声如金，其音如玉； 颊似横陇，颐若阿丘，笼笼日角，隐隐月悬，犀文直理，龙颜神变，金容黄色，玉姿润颜，额有三理，参午上达，天庭平填，兑面寿征； 腹有白痣、颐有玉 丸； 项有三约，鹤素昂昂； 垂手过膝，手把十文； 指有玉甲，身有绿毛； 背有河魁，胸有偃骨； 心有九孔，外有锦文； 脐深一寸，腹软如绵； 脚方如矩，双蹑法轮； 足蹈二五，指有乾坤； 内滋白血，外示老容； 身长丈二，遍体鲜香； 行如虎步，动若龙趋。 此是七十二相也。 左扶青龙，右扶白虎； 头生朱雀，足履玄武； 身若金刚，貌若瑠璃； 圆光五明，头上紫气； 胸前真字。 此九好兼前七十二相，合成八十一好也。 《金书仙志真记》及《后圣九玄道君列纪》并云：青童君曰：夫有骨箓则好仙。 好仙之人，皆有其仙志。 仙志之人，或疲或笃也。 疲则先世善功不足也，笃则玄箓宿命将定也。 大都天箓显於玄宫，则气候□於躯形； 箓字彰於太极，则心神正於丹房。 若生有金阙玉名者，则其人眼有日光，青齿白血。 其为人也，则仁慈而乐仙，明颖而秀挺。 若上清有金书玉箓者，则其人背志如河魁，胸前有偃骨。 其为人也，恭和而下人，德及昆虫。 若太极有丹间青文者，则其人手理，有累人倒大之字。 其为人也，密慎而好真，清虚而容非。 若方诸有玄素紫名者，则其人眼四规中有紫光照鉴其躯。 此为人也，修业渊妙，清今避秽。 若云房有玉纬内书者，则其人圆眼方观，龙口细舌。 其为人也，豁心体真，监分明决。 若朱宫有丹字紫名者，则其人鸾行凤跃、脐宫光泽。 其为人也，竦於问生，开心荡濯。 若太清有玉籍编名者，则其人声有玉音金响，口方目圆。 其为人也，弘施博爱，亲人如母。 若太素有琼简金名者，则其人必白志见於腹，口中有紫气，其为人也，慈德而通神，潜仁而下众。 若南极有丹文紫箓者，则其人头生五气，上接重楼之云。 其为人也，和仁而爱穷，赈厄而济难。 若斗中有玄玉箓籍者，则其人心中有九孔，肺外有锦文，颐下有玉丸，目中有绿筋，眉角当上有干双理，顺文城郭，秃鬓露颡，明堂平白，干理为通真之津，广颡为受灵之宅。 其为人也，慈爱穷贱，仁及乌兽。 若玄宫上元有青金赤书者，则其人丹心紫孔，黄华绕骨，口中气香，齿多玉液。 其为人也，少好视月月之流霞，乐星辰之光景，质清骨坚，精诚深密。 若玄都丹台有白玉金字者，则其人青肝紫络，苍肾绫文，玄膺精溢，形争神洁，身体香软，血清气泽。 其为人也，耽存玄远，味景灵质，好惠下已，救施厄苦。

In the seventh transformation, his body is ten feet tall, wearing an *yuanqi* crown and dragon-serpent robe; in the eighth transformation, his body is eleven feet and five inches tall, wearing a *baibian* crown and natural robe. When Laozi undergoes his ninth transformation, his body possesses seventy-two marks, corresponding to the seventy-two *qi*, and eighty-one excellences.

The seventy-two marks are as follows: His head is round, modeling Heaven; his crown resembles Kunlun. His hair is coiled like morning clouds, his jade-like nape rising gently. His hoary hair is like a crane’s, over seven feet long; his tiger-like whiskers and dragon-like beard are pure and silken. His brows resemble the Northern Dipper, their color like emerald green; between them grows a purple hair, over five inches long. His ears lack outer rims, with three openings within, rising level with his crown, thick and firm. His two eyes are clear as mirrors, their pupils shining with solar essence and purple light; his square pupils are bright and refined, with green veins at their center. His nose has twin pillars, shaped like a cut tube. His mouth is square as the sea, his lips red as cinnabar. His breath carries a purple hue, its fragrance like orchids. His teeth are like contained cowries, firm as silver, thirty-two in number, evenly aligned above and below. His tongue is long and broad, patterned like brocade; jade-like springs overflow within, its taste sweet and fragrant, its sound like gold, its tone like jade. His cheeks resemble transverse ridges, his jaw like a mound; his forehead is radiant as the sun, his temples concealed as the moon. His brow bears straight, rhinoceros-like lines, his dragon-like visage divinely mutable; his golden countenance is yellow-hued, his jade-like bearing lustrous. His forehead has three lines, ascending in alignment; his celestial court is level and full, his face square—a sign of longevity. His abdomen bears white moles, his jaw a jade-like orb. His neck has three folds, white as a crane’s and towering. His arms hang past his knees, his hands bearing ten lines. His fingers have jade-like nails, his body green down. His back bears the *He Kui* star, his chest the recumbent bone. His heart has nine apertures, its exterior patterned like brocade. His navel is an inch deep, his belly soft as silk. His feet are square as a carpenter’s square, his soles like paired *Dharma* wheels. His steps tread the Two and Five, his toes bearing Qian and Kun. His blood is white within, his outward appearance aged. His body is twelve feet tall, his entire form exuding fresh fragrance. His gait is like a tiger’s stride, his movement swift as a dragon’s.

These are the seventy-two marks. To his left, he is supported by the Azure Dragon; to his right, the White Tiger. Above his head arises the Vermilion Bird; beneath his feet treads the Dark Warrior. His body is like *vajra*, his countenance like lapis lazuli. A fivefold radiance encircles him, purple *qi* rises above his head, and the true character gleams upon his chest. These nine excellences, combined with the preceding seventy-two marks, form the eighty-one excellences.

The *Golden Book of Immortal Records* and the *Arrayed Chronicles of the Nine Mysteries of the Later Sage* both state: The Azure Lad said, "Those with bone registers are inclined toward immortality. Those inclined toward immortality possess immortal aspirations. Among those with immortal aspirations, some are weary, others steadfast. Weariness stems from insufficient merit in past lives; steadfastness arises when the mysterious register and predestined fate are settled. Generally, when celestial registers manifest in the Mysterious Palace, the *qi* and seasons align with the bodily form; when register characters are revealed in the Supreme Ultimate, the heart and spirit are rectified in the cinnabar chamber. If one is born with a name inscribed in the Golden Tower and Jade Register, their eyes will shine with solar light, their teeth will be green, and their blood white. Such a person is benevolent and delights in immortality, intelligent and outstanding. If one possesses the Golden Book and Jade Register of the Upper Clarity, their back will bear the *He Kui* star and their chest the recumbent bone. Such a person is reverent, humble, and extends virtue even to insects. If one bears the cinnabar script and azure characters of the Supreme Ultimate, their hands will display the characters of 'inverted greatness' and 'accumulated humanity.' Such a person is discreet and devoted to truth, pure and tolerant of others. If one has a name inscribed in the dark and white registers of the *Fangzhu*, their eyes will have four pupils with purple light illuminating their form. Such a person cultivates profound and wondrous practices, cleanses the present, and avoids defilement. If one bears the inner jade weft of the Cloud Chamber, their eyes will be round and observant, their mouth dragon-like, their tongue fine. Such a person is open-hearted and embodies truth, discerning and decisive. If one has a cinnabar character and purple name in the Vermilion Palace, their movements will resemble the phoenix’s dance and the simurgh’s leap, their navel palace radiant. Such a person is attentive to life’s inquiries, their heart open and pure. If one has their name compiled in the Jade Register of the Grand Clarity, their voice will carry the tone of jade and the resonance of gold, their mouth square, their eyes round. Such a person is magnanimous and broadly loving, cherishing others as a mother. If one has a name inscribed on the jade slips of the Grand Simplicity, their abdomen will reveal a white aspiration, their mouth emit purple *qi*. Such a person is compassionate and spiritually attuned, humbly benevolent toward all. If one bears the cinnabar script and purple register of the Southern Culmen, five *qi* will rise from their head, connecting to the layered clouds of the celestial towers. Such a person is harmonious, benevolent, and aids the destitute, relieving hardship and rescuing from peril. If one has their name recorded in the mysterious jade registers of the Dipper, their heart will have nine apertures, their lungs bear brocade-like patterns, their jaw a jade orb, their eyes green veins, and their brow angles two ascending lines. Their facial contours are orderly, their temples exposed, their bright hall level and white. The dry lines serve as the passage to true transcendence, the broad forehead as the dwelling of the numinous. Such a person is compassionate toward the poor and humble, their benevolence extending even to birds and beasts. If one bears the azure-gold and cinnabar script of the Upper Primordial in the Mysterious Palace, their heart will be cinnabar with purple apertures, their bones encircled by yellow blossoms, their breath fragrant, and their teeth filled with jade-like fluid. Such a person delights in gazing at the moon’s flowing rosy clouds and the stars’ luminous scenes from youth, their essence pure, their bones firm, their sincerity deep and secret. If one has a name inscribed in white jade and gold characters on the Cinnabar Terrace of the Mysterious Capital, their liver will be green with purple vessels, their kidneys patterned like layered silk, their dark breast brimming with essence, their form rivaling their spirit in purity. Their body is fragrant and supple, their blood clear, their *qi* lustrous. Such a person is devoted to the distant and mysterious, savoring the numinous essence, benevolent toward inferiors, and rescues those in hardship and suffering."

chunks.original_text: 若三元宫有琳札青书者，则其人紫脑锦舌，玄志鬓际，绿肠朱髓，方足圆额，阴有仗骨，软发紫泽，孔门三阙，起居似涩，眼有流光，青精凝液，掌文四菌，齿牙三腭。 其为人也，灵心仁爱，慈感发神，好微敬信，乐林与春，爱水清流，怀感山川，愿投名阿，保魄养魂，志凌清泰，远慕天仙。 诸有如此上十三形，悉皆上相，必得上仙，亦可学而得，亦可不学而获。 其次鼻上有玄山。 玄山者，鼻上有黑志是也。 又当使腹上有玄丘，对玄山也。 玄丘者，亦黑志也。 若阙其一，皆不合仙相。 若口臭而性耐秽者，都坏玄山玄丘之相矣。 其次青骨。 青骨者，其为人也，皆乐闻五香之气，好学神灵之事。 其次鹤行龙趋，项生玉枕，耳后伏晨，胁下有青志，体生络文，及心真胆静，耳坚气宽，此皆次仙之相也。 《高上虚皇君道经第一》云：羽衣命仙，骨有玉映，血成琼泉，生乐天地，日月同年。 《内音玉字下》云：玉眸者，流火之膏也。 既受赤明和阳天中流火，而炼体生玉光，绛府充盈，万神并归。 《紫度炎光经》云：太上大道君游宴之圆光，上激九天之威，下灭六天之凶，玄光虚映道君之顶，流照八极四十万里也。 《龙飞尺素隐诀》云：身生宝曜，项负圆光。 《大洞雌一篇目》云：金姿曜於东华，玉形蜕於帝门。 神映五老，腾跃三元。 灵羽披空，气浩庆云。 又能身生水火，放光万仞。 项负宝曜，浮游九晨。 分形散景，位为上真。 又云：玉童玉女，面上皆有玉华金晨之光，映曜一形。 《四极明科》云：项生圆明，映照十天也。 又云：得此上清隐书，目有回精，面生紫容。 又云：归童日晖虚生之章，目有回精流光之瞳。 《上清变化七十四方经》云：南极长生之君王易度，面发日精，目生电光也。 又云：三天玉童，项有圆光，体生玉精，手把景云，足践七元。 又云：骨化结玉，仙容华盈。 《神州七转七变经》云：紫晨君面发金容，体映玉光，五色紫章，七十二变，精耀玉颜也。 又云：能行神州七转舞天之道，则体发金光，面映金容，七星络躯，乘云升晨。 《金珰上经》云：目明彻视，洞睹幽穷。 面有金容，体生玉津。 又云：面有玉泽，体生奇光，内外洞朗也。 《外国放品经》云：青童君顶生宝光，映曜十天也。 《裴君内传》云：清灵真人裴君，字玄仁，少为人清明，颜仪整素，善於言笑，目中有精光，垂臂下膝，声气高彻，呼如钟鸣也。 又云：目中有珠子，正似北斗魒星，自已下象如河魁，此神仙之志也。 《本行经》云：阿丘、曾众好备发三十二相洞映女形也。 《内音玉字上》云：凡修飞仙之道，体生玉光也。 《五符》云：皇人身长九尺，玄毛被体，皆长尺余，发才长数寸，居在峨眉北绝岩之下。 《大洞玉经三十九章注》云：上皇真人顶负宝曜，体映圆光，气合三素，灵洞五藏也。 《洞房内经序》云：仙十相者：第一生有金格玉名； 第二大玄宫有素箓； 第三左手有大字；

If the Three Primordials Palace bears jade tablets inscribed in azure script, such a person will have a purple brain and brocade tongue, dark aspirations at the temples, green intestines and vermilion marrow, square feet and rounded brow, hidden reinforcing bones, soft hair with purple sheen, three gates at the orifices, movements slightly restrained, eyes gleaming with flowing light, azure essence congealing into fluid, palms marked with four fungi, and teeth with triple palates. Such a person possesses a numinous heart and benevolent love, their kindness stirring the divine; they delight in subtle reverence and trust, love forests and spring, cherish clear-flowing waters, hold mountains and rivers in their heart, yearn to inscribe their name on the Azure Peak, preserve their *po* and nurture their *hun*, their aspirations soaring toward serene tranquility, and long for the celestial immortals.

All who bear these thirteen superior forms are of the highest destiny, certain to attain the rank of supreme immortality—this may be achieved through study or even without it.

Next is the Dark Mountain upon the nose. The Dark Mountain refers to a black mark upon the nose. There should also be a Dark Mound upon the abdomen, directly opposite the Dark Mountain. The Dark Mound is likewise a black mark. If either is lacking, the immortal’s physiognomy is incomplete. If one’s breath is foul and one’s nature tolerates filth, the signs of the Dark Mountain and Dark Mound are entirely ruined.

Next is the Azure Bone. Those with Azure Bone delight in the fragrance of the five incenses and are drawn to the study of divine and numinous matters.

Next are the crane’s gait and dragon’s stride, a jade pillow upon the nape, hidden dawn behind the ears, azure marks beneath the ribs, a network of veins upon the body, a true heart and tranquil gall, firm ears and expansive *qi*—these are all signs of lesser immortals.

The *Scripture of the Supreme Void Sovereign Lord, First Scroll* states: "The feather-robed destiny-immortals bear bones suffused with jade radiance, their blood transformed into nectarous springs; they rejoice in heaven and earth, their years equal to the sun and moon."

The *Lower Scroll of the Jade Characters of Inner Sound* states: "Jade pupils are the essence of flowing fire. Having received the crimson brilliance of the Harmonious Yang Heaven’s flowing fire, they refine the body to generate jade light, filling the Crimson Palace, where the ten thousand spirits converge."

The *Scripture of the Purple Florescence and Blazing Light* states: "The Great Dao Lord of the Supreme traverses the radiant aureole, its light surging upward to awaken the might of the Nine Heavens, descending to extinguish the malice of the Six Heavens. The mysterious light’s empty radiance crowns the Dao Lord’s head, flowing to illuminate the eight directions for four hundred thousand *li*."

The *Hidden Instructions of the Dragon-Flight Plain Silk* states: "The body generates precious luminosity, the nape bears a halo of light."

The *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Jade Scripture* states: "A golden countenance shines upon the Eastern Flower, a jade form sheds its skin at the Emperor’s Gate. The spirit mirrors the Five Elders, leaping through the Three Primordials. Numinous feathers drape the void, *qi* vast as auspicious clouds. They can also manifest water and fire, emit light for ten thousand *ren*, bear precious luminosity upon the nape, and roam the Nine Mornings. Dispersing their form and scattering their radiance, they ascend as supreme perfected ones."

It further states: "Jade lads and jade maidens, their faces all aglow with jade splendor and golden dawn’s light, illuminate their entire form."

The *Bright Codes of the Four Poles* states: "A halo upon the nape shines to illuminate the Ten Heavens." It also states: "Those who obtain these hidden writings of the Supreme Clarity will have eyes with revolving essence and faces suffused with purple complexion." And: "The chapter *Returning Youth and the Sun’s Radiance, Born of the Void* grants eyes with revolving essence and pupils of flowing light."

The *Seventy-Four Methods of the Supreme Clarity’s Transformations* states: "The Lord of Longevity at the Southern Pole, Wang Yidu, emits solar essence from his face and lightning from his eyes." It further states: "The Jade Lads of the Three Heavens bear halos upon their napes, their bodies generating jade essence, their hands grasping luminous clouds, their feet treading the Seven Primordials." And: "Bones transform and coalesce into jade, the immortal’s countenance flourishing with splendor."

The *Seven Revolutions and Seven Transformations of the Divine Continent* states: "The Purple Dawn Lord’s face emits a golden complexion, his body suffused with jade light, five-colored purple patterns, seventy-two transformations, his essence illuminating his jade visage." It further states: "Those who practice the *Seven Revolutions of the Divine Continent and the Heaven-Dancing Way* will emit golden light from their bodies, their faces aglow with golden radiance, the Seven Stars networked upon their forms, riding clouds to ascend the mornings."

The *Upper Scripture of the Golden Pendants* states: "Eyes bright and penetrating, perceiving the deepest mysteries. A golden complexion upon the face, the body generating jade essence." It further states: "A face with jade luster, the body generating wondrous light, inner and outer brilliance."

The *Scripture of the Foreign Lands’ Liberated Grades* states: "The Azure Lad’s crown emits precious light, illuminating the Ten Heavens."

The *Inner Biography of Lord Pei* states: "The Pure Numinous Perfected, Lord Pei, styled Xuanren, was clear and bright from youth, his countenance and bearing refined and unadorned, skilled in speech and laughter, his eyes bearing essence-light, his arms hanging past his knees, his voice and *qi* resonant and far-reaching, his call ringing like a bell." It further states: "His eyes held pearls resembling the Northern Dipper’s stars, their lower aspect like the River Chariot—this is the aspiration of divine immortals."

The *Scripture of Fundamental Conduct* states: "Aqiu and Zengzhong, their thirty-two marks fully manifest, illuminate the female form."

The *Upper Scroll of the Jade Characters of Inner Sound* states: "All who cultivate the Way of Flying Immortals generate jade light from their bodies."

The *Five Talismans* states: "The August Person stands nine *chi* tall, his body covered in dark hair, each over a *chi* long, his hair only a few *cun* in length, dwelling beneath the sheer cliffs north of Mount Emei."

The *Commentary on the Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Jade Scripture* states: "The Supreme August Perfected bears precious luminosity upon his crown, his body suffused with a halo of light, his *qi* harmonizing the Three Simplicities, his spirit penetrating the Five Viscera."

The *Preface to the Scripture of the Inner Chamber* states: "The Ten Signs of Immortality: First, born with a golden frame and jade name; second, the Great Mysterious Palace bears a plain register; third, the left hand bears a great character..."

Their body is fragrant and supple, their blood clear, their *qi* lustrous. Such a person is devoted to the distant and mysterious, savoring the numinous essence, benevolent toward inferiors, and rescues those in hardship and suffering."

chunks.original_text: 第四背有青志，象如河魁； 第五身有七星志； 第六顶中有紫光，自照见其体； 第七鹤行龙趋，身体络文； 第八心中九孔，肺下青穴； 第九头生五气，上接重云； 第十玉声金响，口生紫气。 若生有此者，不须学道，期必仙也。 《奔日月二景隐文》云：高皇玉帝承玉虚皇流之冑，琼骨金髓，凤脑龙胎也。 《上清真文玉经朝文》云：眼有玄光，口有玉浆，鼻有玉火，耳有镇神，心有九孔，上道九天，足有八史，上造天门，坐起眠息，玉童执言，北斗七星，常在胸前也。 《道学传第四》云：范材者，白哲而美发，秀眉明目也。 《三皇醮仪》云：令臣等得仙，身生紫络羽文也。 《道学传第七》云：陆修静，字元德，吴兴东迁人也。 及生之日，跖音只有重轮，足有双踝，掌有大字，身有斗文也。 第八卷云：陶弘景，字通明，魏郡平阳人也。 神仪端洁，形长七尺二寸，头耸耳高，两耳各有十余长毛，右股内有数十黑子，多作七星文，眼中见有奇异光象也。 第九卷云：薛彪之，晋陵人也。 服御众蕊，年高色少，须发缁润也。 《列仙传》云：偓佺者，槐山采药人也。 好食松实，形体生毛长数寸，而目更方，能飞行逮走马也。 又云：阳都女者，都市上沽酒家女也。 生而眉连，耳细而长，众以为异，皆言此天人也。 以妻邺人犊子，犊子与之俱去入山焉。 《列仙传下》云：宁先生毛身，广耳，被发也。 《老子道德经》云：头发茂盛，得道之根； 手足汗津，精气充盈； 昼夜不外，日月合光； 不饥不渴，龟龙胎息也。 《本际经第四》云：太上道君以他心智及宿命通无碍道，眼遥观宿因，浅劣所悟未真也。 《四极明科》云：若有玄名帝图，紫简录字、玉藏金骨之人，千年之内得三传《大洞真经》也。 又云：《九真中经》秘於太上六合宫中，若有青书东华、玉字上清、藏生紫络之人，七百年内听得三传也。 又云：《太丹隐书》藏於太上六合紫房之内，若有金名帝图绿字、紫骨合真之人，七百年内听得三传也。 又云：《青要紫书》，若有金髓玉骨、名书帝箓，七百年内听得三传也。 《太玄都右宫女青四极明科文》云：上清宝藏，玉骨之人得传《四极明科》也。 《清虚真人王君内传》云：王君，讳褒，字子登。 服龙明珠绛和云芝草，即身有金映，项生圆光，七曜散华，流晖焕形也。 《南岳夫人内传》云：夫人之质，霄景高焕，圆精重照，凤体龙骨，脑色宝曜，五藏紫络，心有羽文也。 《太上八景经》云：服四药紫浆五珠绛生神丹者，即头生九晨之光，面有玉华，飞映宝曜，洞观天下，腾空上造紫虚，出入玉清，寝宴晨房也。 又云：飞步天纲秘於玉虚紫房之内，若有金名帝箓玉札上清骨相合真之人，七百年内听得三传。 又云：三天正法秘於九天之上玉清金房紫户之内，若有金名玉字紫藏玉髓之人，七百年内听得三传。 《金箓简文经》云：闭眼存见体作金色，项有圆光，光如日象，昭明十方，身中了然，尽见内外也。 《消魔真符经》云：有金髓玉骨，五藏生华，体发奇光，名参青箱，得见洞经。 《紫虚元君内传》云：景林真人语华存曰：今视子之质，霄景高焕，圆精重照，凤体龙骨，脑色宝曜，五藏紫络，心有羽文，是以形栖晨霞，神交灵津也。

Fourth, the back bears a blue mark resembling the River Chariot; fifth, the body bears the Seven Stars’ mark; sixth, the crown emits a purple radiance that illuminates the body; seventh, the gait is like a crane’s and the stride like a dragon’s, with the body adorned in networked patterns; eighth, the heart has nine apertures and beneath the lungs lies a blue cavity; ninth, the head generates five *qi* that ascend to meet layered clouds; tenth, the voice rings like jade and gold, and the mouth exhales purple *qi*. Those born with these signs need not study the Dao—they are destined to become immortals.

The *Hidden Writings of the Two Luminaries, Sun and Moon* states: "The August Jade Emperor descends from the Jade Void Sovereign’s lineage, his bones of jade and marrow of gold, born of phoenix brain and dragon embryo."

The *Morning Audience Writ of the Jade Scripture of the Upper Clarity True Writ* states: "His eyes hold mysterious light, his mouth flows with jade nectar, his nose emits jade fire, his ears command numinous spirits, his heart has nine apertures, and he ascends the Nine Heavens of the Dao. His feet bear the Eight Historians, and he ascends to the Gate of Heaven. When he sits, rises, sleeps, or rests, jade lads attend his words, and the Seven Stars of the Northern Dipper ever dwell before his breast."

*The Fourth Scroll of the Transmission of Daoist Learning* states: "Fan Cai had fair skin and beautiful hair, with elegant brows and bright eyes."

*The Ritual of the Three Sovereigns* states: "May we attain immortality, our bodies adorned with purple networked feather patterns."

*The Seventh Scroll of the Transmission of Daoist Learning* states: "Lu Xiujing, styled Yuande, was a native of Dongqian in Wuxing. On the day of his birth, his soles bore double wheels, his feet had twin ankles, his palms bore great characters, and his body bore the Dipper’s pattern."

The eighth scroll states: "Tao Hongjing, styled Tongming, was a native of Pingyang in Weijun. His bearing was dignified and pure, his stature seven *chi* and two *cun* tall, his head towering and ears high. Each ear bore over ten long hairs, his right thigh had several dozen black moles arranged in the Seven Stars’ pattern, and his eyes beheld wondrous radiant phenomena."

The ninth scroll states: "Xue Biaozhi was a native of Jinling. He consumed multitudes of blossoms, his years advanced yet his complexion youthful, his beard and hair lustrous and black."

*The Biographies of the Immortals* states: "Wo Quan was a gatherer of herbs on Mount Huai. Fond of eating pine nuts, his body grew hair several *cun* long, his eyes became square, and he could fly to keep pace with galloping horses."

It further states: "The Lady of Yangdu was a girl who sold wine in the marketplace. Born with joined brows and long, slender ears, all marveled at her, calling her a celestial being. She wed a man of Ye named Duzi, and together they entered the mountains."

*The Latter Biographies of the Immortals* states: "Master Ning had a hairy body, broad ears, and unbound hair."

The *Laozi’s Scripture on Virtue and the Dao* states: "Thick hair is the root of attaining the Dao; sweat on hands and feet signals abundant essence-*qi*. Day and night undistracted, the sun and moon merge their light; free from hunger and thirst, one practices the breath of the tortoise and dragon."

*The Fourth Scripture of the Origin* states: "The Most High Dao Lord, with his wisdom of others’ minds and unhindered knowledge of past lives, could observe distant karmic causes, though the shallow and dull had yet to awaken to truth."

*The Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* states: "Those with names inscribed on the Mysterious Register of the Imperial Chart, characters on purple slips, and bones of jade and gold may receive three transmissions of the *True Scripture of the Great Cavern* within a thousand years."

It further states: "The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected* is concealed in the Six Harmonies Palace of the Most High. Those with names written in blue on the Eastern Florescence, jade characters of the Upper Clarity, and bodies bearing purple networks may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years."

It further states: "The *Hidden Writ of the Great Elixir* is concealed within the Purple Chamber of the Six Harmonies Palace of the Most High. Those with names inscribed on the Imperial Chart in green characters and bones of purple that harmonize with the True may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years."

It further states: "The *Purple Writ of the Blue Essentials*—those with marrow of gold and bones of jade, their names inscribed on the Imperial Register, may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years."

*The Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Right Palace of the Great Mystery Capital* states: "Those with jade bones may transmit the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* from the treasure store of the Upper Clarity."

*The Inner Biography of Perfected Lord Wang of the Clear Void* states: "Perfected Lord Wang, whose name was Bao and style Zideng, consumed dragon-bright pearls and crimson harmonious cloud fungi. His body radiated golden light, his neck bore a halo, the Seven Luminaries scattered blossoms, and flowing radiance illumined his form."

*The Inner Biography of the Lady of the Southern Marchmount* states: "Her essence was lofty and resplendent, her round spirit doubly radiant, her body that of a phoenix and bones of a dragon. Her brain shone with precious luminosity, her five viscera bore purple networks, and her heart had feathered patterns."

*The Scripture of the Eight Luminaries of the Most High* states: "Those who consume the four medicines, purple nectar, five pearls, and crimson life-generating elixir will have their heads emit the light of the Nine Dawns, their faces bear jade splendor, and flying radiance illumine precious luminosity. They will perceive all under heaven, ascend through the void to the Purple Void, enter and exit the Jade Clarity, and repose in the Morning Chamber."

It further states: "The *Secret of the Celestial Net’s Flight* is concealed within the Purple Chamber of the Jade Void. Those with names inscribed on the Imperial Register in gold, jade tablets of the Upper Clarity, and bones harmonizing with the True may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years."

It further states: "The *Orthodox Law of the Three Heavens* is concealed within the Golden Chamber of the Jade Clarity atop the Nine Heavens. Those with names inscribed in gold and jade characters, bodies bearing purple storehouses and jade marrow, may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years."

*The Scripture of the Golden Register’s Simplified Writ* states: "Closing the eyes and visualizing the body as golden, the neck bears a halo like the sun’s image, illuminating the ten directions. Within the body, all is clearly seen, both inner and outer."

*The Scripture of the True Talismans for Dispelling Demons* states: "Those with marrow of gold and bones of jade, whose five viscera generate blossoms and bodies emit wondrous light, whose names are recorded in the Blue Box, may behold the Cavern Scripture."

*The Inner Biography of the Purple Void Primordial Lady* states: "Perfected Lady Jinglin said to Hua Cun: 'Now I observe your essence—lofty and resplendent, your round spirit doubly radiant, your body that of a phoenix and bones of a dragon. Your brain shines with precious luminosity, your five viscera bear purple networks, and your heart has feathered patterns. Thus your form dwells in the morning clouds, and your spirit communes with the numinous streams.'"

chunks.original_text: 方协德太．平，理仙佐治，挺应称用，才亦伟铄。 夫人之任，谅不虚矣。 《太极隐秘宝诀经》云：太极真人曰：夫人有仙真相好者，其要在慈心。 触物以辅相好，然后得仙矣。 不能忍性容非，仙相败矣。 《无上真人内传》云：尹喜眼有日精，姿形长雅，垂臂过膝，项负圆耀，五藏有文，面有七星，上象天文，下顺地理，莫不备足，故寄惠炼质，逝生末劫，当为贵真之长也。 诸天年号月月品 《三九素语玉精真诀》云：九天丈人、三天玉童，以上始元年天甲吉辰时，加北维移度，停轩三元，齐景九帝，回真登高上玉馆紫虚之天。 《三九素语》：披解《灵关玉精真诀》，总御万仙也。 《三元玉检三元布经》云：清虚元年元始天王於明霞之馆太霄云房，教三天玉童三元玉检之经也。 又云：清虚元年岁在庚寅九月九日上甲值辰，元始天王飞斋上清宫，告盟无上、无巅、无色、无影、无形、无名、无祖、无宗、无极、无穷，洞清九玄自然无数劫道，授三元玉检三天玉童，使付后学有玄名应为上清真人者。 《大洞经下》云：青龙元年太岁在辛亥九月一日夜，受此《大洞经三十九章》於紫微王夫人也。 《玉帝七圣玄纪回天九霄经》曰：中皇元年九月七日，七圣齐灵，奉回天九霄白简青箓之经，解其曲理也。 《上清八景飞度经》云：九天丈人以建始元年岁在东维天甲吉辰清斋，太空七宝琼台以金青盟天，请受灵篇，招灵摄魔，豁落七元玄章也。 《登真隐诀》云：混皇三年，太虚上霄飞晨中黄老道君，年七岁，知长生之要。 《上清九真中经内诀》云：中央黄老以清灵上皇六年生也。 《七星移度经》云：帝君五愿求仙上法者，帝君常以九月九日、十月五日、三月三日、四月八日、七月七日，此五愿十会之时也。 上登太极琼宫高上玉殿金室之内，存五愿於闲宫，希玄真以自降虚无，启以玉章金音，畅於太空，召五帝以卫灵，度万会於丹房，故有感而致真，真感发而降焉。 是其日当沐浴清斋，入室烧香，心拜四方，正东向，平坐。 东向者，是当阳始晖之方也。 叩齿三十六通，以念愿云： 第一上愿我生自然之气，气中结成我身，与三光齐伦，长享无极之根。 二愿我身常处太空之上琼宫玉房之裹，朝与玉帝同宴，夕与玄母同几，渴翕浪井洪泉玉芝，饥纳龙胎琼腴绛树赤子。 三愿我身生万瑞七十二光，奇毛异骨，飞羽衣裳，乘虚驾空，出入帝宫，众庆来臻，万寿无量。 四愿与无俱生，与无俱死，死而又生，生为帝王，封掌十天，总领群仙。 五愿一切众生，已生未生，同保日月三光有道之人，七玄之祖，上升南宫，天下之福靡有不当，四方五愿并会玉堂。 次上愿九玄扶养我身，魂魄真神恒居我宫，上通天仙，下逮洞渊。 愿天，愿地，愿风，愿云，愿神，五愿一合，定籍长生。 天降紫烟，地卫五灵。 乘云驾虚，飞辇绿軿，上造金阙，进登玉清，庆及七祖，更受胎生，上愿五合，长享利贞。 中愿亦五：愿得道本根，愿阴阳，愿太空，愿太无，愿太玄。 上宴玉房，与帝因缘，游眄生门，披浪九天，元父定籍，玄母记年，桃康结精，保固丹田，身腾金阙，名书玉篇，七祖解脱，福庆来臻。 下愿亦五：愿太虚，愿太有，愿太上，愿太真，愿神仙。
